content: I've heard that some shorebirds can be difficult to distinguish even when they're not in breeding plumage. I've been trying to improve my bird identification skills, and I've been keeping a bird watching journal to record my sightings. By the way, speaking of my journal, I saw a pair of American Goldfinches and a Red-winged Blackbird at the nature reserve on March 17th, which was a great addition to my journal.
